Definitely expect Health First to no longer be an ok place to work for and look elsewhere. The environment here is toxic.

patients are just dollar signs and employees are numbers
not many other options for hospital based employees or patients  in the area

review_title: Management bullies doing administrations dirty work
job_title: Staff RN in Cape Canaveral, FL
pros: The employees are some of the most talented, caring, and proficient people I worked with in my 30 year career.
cons: Managers, under the direction of administration, bully those they are supposed to be supporting. Every unit was like a family for the first nine years I worked there.  After the current administration came in about two years ago, it became very top heavy with administrators and managers and very evident that they were given specific instructions to do the horrible things that they did. Up to four people were fired at one time, employees would be targeted and then tormented with bogus write-ups until they either quit or were fired.  And I am talking about people who had been with this organization 10, 20, 30 years. Going up the administrative ladder was a joke because they were all part of it. It was devastating to watch one great co-worker after another be tortured, and then leave. Risk management, corporate compliance, and the administrators were each notified at one time or another and would always come back saying the complaint was unfounded. All I can say is shame on you! Karma is a ........

pros: Getting to be a nurse

review_title: Very watchful, runs a tight ship

Monday through Friday, 9:00AM-5:00PM
secured building
every department has a level of clearance

Contract job, temporary

pros: good benefits that they offer

job_title: Patient Transporter in Cape Canaveral, FL
pros: I love my coworkers, the hours were flexible, and they even threw me a baby shower.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Viera, FL
pros: I'm looking forward to growth.

pros: You can Learn new skills

review_title: Overall, good company, but poor management in certain departments.
pros: Good benefits and time off.
cons: Poor management, although several have been replaced.

pros: pay and benefits are decent

review_title: Good Potential but lacks competent leadership
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Satellite Beach, FL
pros: Benefits and work schedule flexibility
cons: Poor management and I hope but takeover by Advent will help change

pros: Good pay for experience I have
cons: Not enough money for what we actually do

pros: Great culture. Senior leadership are innovative thinkers.
cons: The area has occasionall weather events that demamds most team members get involved in organizational continuity.

job_title: Computed Tomography Technologist in Manchester, NH
pros: Competitive pay, good reputation in the community
cons: No weekend differential, employees are not a main focus

job_title: Lead Sterile Processing Technician in Melbourne, FL
pros:
Good salary
Plenty opportunity to grow
cons: Revolving management in all locations

pros: The one and only good thing about Health First is self scheduling for RNs who work 3 12-hour shifts a week. You can choose the days you want to work and are usually granted what you request, except for required weekends and holidays.
cons: Literally everything else. Terrible turn over with employees, staff literally, actually "hate" working there (we all talk to each other so I know). Constantly understaffed, overworked, and low morale. You are overworked to utter misery. I felt like a slave. The whole time I worked here I was denied a merit increase. They will deny you a raise for any reason such as; you got your flu shot 1 day late, you did your N95 fit test 1 day late, you submitted your online learning 1 day late, you submitted any required module 1 day late, and more. If you clock in 1 minute late or 1 minute early, you get a point and at 10 points you are fired! If you are wrongly given a point by mistake and do not tell your manager to correct it within a certain amount of time, the point stays on your record! This place HATES their employees! They don't care about you, they care about profits and warm bodies filling a position. Undoubtedly the WORST employer I have EVER worked for. Even Worsthoff is better and I worked there too!

pros:
The health insurance for full time employees is very affordable, and provides great coverage. Salaries are fair, and the company seems to respect employees.

Other benefits include dental, vision, 401k matching, gym membership, and tuition reimbursement.
cons:
Not enough paid leave time. They say you get 3 weeks a year, but holidays like Christmas and Thanksgiving come out of that time. There are no paid holidays, so at least one week a year goes towards the various holidays, and you have no choice but to take them off.

The company offers sick time, but you are penalized through the "points" system if you take a sick day. 

They are also extremely strict about clocking in and out on time. If you're even one minute late, you are penalized with more points. 

Most departments do not offer flexible work schedules. And if your manager does approve it, it's very tedious for the timekeeper due to the strict scheduling rules.

pros:
The health insurance for full time employees is very affordable, and provides great coverage. Salaries are fair, and the company seems to respect employees.

Other benefits include dental, vision, 401k matching, gym membership, and tuition reimbursement.
cons:
Not enough paid leave time. They say you get 3 weeks a year, but holidays like Christmas and Thanksgiving come out of that time. There are no paid holidays, so at least one week a year goes towards the various holidays, and you have no choice but to take them off.

The company offers sick time, but you are penalized through the "points" system if you take a sick day. 

They are also extremely strict about clocking in and out on time. If you're even one minute late, you are penalized with more points. 

Most departments do not offer flexible work schedules. And if your manager does approve it, it's very tedious for the timekeeper due to the strict scheduling rules.

pros: *most* of the employees in IT are awesome people to work with an genuinely care about moving the company forward -- this doesn't include anyone above a manager level.
cons:
This is specifically related to the culture of the IT department at the business center. I can't speak for other areas.

1. Everyone works in fear of losing their jobs.

2. Employees who work hard are rewarded with even more work.

3. Employees are micromanaged by directors instead of letting managers be leaders to their teams.

4. Employees who have opinions against management are chastised and even written up. They have even gone as far as to attempt to fire people but HR could not find just cause.

5. If you are considered to be friends with people whom management does not like, you will have zero opportunity to move to a different department or receive a promotion.

6.  Management has been hiring people who are not qualified for positions because they don't want technically capable employees, they want people who will blindly follow. Their justification is "well qualified people leave too quickly."

review_title: Management doesn't care. Only matters that there are warm bodies so rooms can be filled
pros: Some of the employees are some of the best and most caring nurses in the county, they stand apart from the rest, but are few and far between.
cons: The other employees are incompetent and lazy, backstabbing and underhanded. The management prefers to have employees who don't buck the system. Nepotism, supposedly against health first policy, is rampant in some departments and management looks out for friends and pushes anyone who speaks up out the door. If you become a target expect everything you do to be scrutinized and expect no one to listen to your side of the story. Await your meeting where you get blindsided by well documented nitpickings of your performance, while gross failures of policy and patient safety by others are ignored, expect to hear about that time you once didn't smile enough when asking another for help. Never mind the heparin drip that wasn't started for an entire shift by a coworker, ignore the techs in the hallway clustered together snap chatting, don't even bother to pay any mind to the managers favorites who commit med error after med error.

pros: None. None. None. None. None
cons: First and foremost, most of these 4 and 5 star reviews on here were strategically placed by management and/admin. As General consensus, no one likes their job so stop trying to even out the rating by placing bogus reviews. Health First you are not fooling anyone. You do not care about your employees. You are a "bully". Unfortunately the monopoly you've created makes you the only game in town for the underdog. Work on getting rid of your poor nursing administration, especially at Viera and HRMC. Listen to the staff. Security at Viera is a joke. We get cursed at, spit at, things thrown at us and they are not allowed to take down a patient or even lay hands on one if a situation were to arrive. Don't feel safe.

review_title: Very professional teams working against impossible odds
job_title: Patient Benefit Advisor in Melbourne, FL
pros: Health First is the best Enterprise employer in Brevard County outside of the Aerospace/Defense companies. You should work here if you're interested in medicine, general business, insurance, or social work. This company stands by its rules very firmly and its very easy to take advantage of the employer or face rule changes that make your job much more difficult. It's a constant give and take.
cons: Some managers are ruthless, some employees can be brainless, and you will suddenly and unexpectedly have the book thrown at you if you're not careful. But if you protect yourself and play it smart, everyone is a blast to work with and everyday is different and filled with unique challenges. Keep in mind work is a financial arrangement and keep your vacation saved up to protect yourself.

review_title: Poor Management Provides For Disgruntled Employees
pros:
Excellent Health Plan, but then again, they are a health facility.

Free Membership to the gym.

Personal time is accrued bi-weekly and can be used at employee's discretion.

Educational compensation available, but you must stay for years after degree.
cons: Great discrepancy between salaries of people with equal experience and education.  Opportunity for advancement is rare and often times they hire outside the company - you have to be part of the clique - good old boy mentality.  Even though management is reviewed, there never seems to be any change.  The Peter Principle applies throughout this firm - people are advanced to their level of incompetence.  Innovation is not encouraged or rewarded and thinking "outside the box" is frowned upon.  Raises have been given and then taken back - yes this occurs regularly! Don't try to make any waves or complain about problems or you could be fired - this is especially true in the Maintenance Department in all facilities.

review_title: Great job, Great people, Great pay
pros: Friendly employees.  Coworkers make everyone fell welcome and are there to help each other out. The pay was great. There was opportunities to grow and move up in the company. Fair competitive wages.  They provide outside technical training to improve their employees skillsets.  They have a budget for ongoing training.   They maintain a professional atmosphere.
cons: There was a lot of turnover in the mid and upper management. In the time I was there I had 5 different managers 3 different directors and 3 different CIOs. This made it difficult to understand what direction to follow and meet expectations. Once you figured out what the manager expects of you and the way they like things done, you had a new manager with completely different ideas and expectations. The performance metrics were consistently changing and there was no clear communication of what the new metrics were.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Bay, FL
pros: The benefits seem fair, but could be more cost effective. HF owns the ins company. The hospital associates should not have worse policies than they see coming across the desks
cons: inability to get time off approved. Constantly working short handed. Always having the same people do the OT, and not require everyone to share rather than burn out the willing associates.

pros: I worked at Viera Hospital as a monitor tech and loved the small, family atmosphere. The staff really care about patient care and work great as a team. Job growth or change is encouraged. The health insurance is excellent. I was on vacation during the last mandatory hurricane shift, but everyone spoke about how the team came together and associates were taken care of by the administration. This is important on the coast of FL!
cons: The rapid population growth in Brevard, especially Viera, can leave staff feeling short at times. To waive the $500 deductible for associate health insurance, we are required to complete an online assessment with extremely confidential personal health info. I fear this info could be breached like so many other hacks that occur to even major corporations.

pros: The work (what is done and why) is rewarding.
cons:
Micromanagement; inconsistent application of corporate policies; Sick leave policies left up to the interpretation of individual supervisors and no clear definition of terms in the corporate policy (i.e. What, exactly, is a "routine doctor's appointment"?)

Managers with no people or leadership skills; lack of recognition or compensation for excellent job performance; managers that take credit for their subordinates ideas, work, or accomplishments. 

In a nutshell, this organization needs clarification of its policies and a big move toward applying the same standards to all---not allowing each manager/department head to make up their own rules.

Finally, the entire workforce would benefit from bringing the union in to help ensure fair and equitable treatment for all, as well as to negotiate appropriate compensation packages.

job_title: Organizational Development Practitioner in Melbourne, FL
pros: This organization is moving quickly to remain a significant player in an industry that is consolidating quickly. The people who work here are great and there are many opportunities to get involved in growth initiatives. Those looking to gain experience will benefit greatly from this type of environment.
cons: Fast growth comes with growing pains. Change initiatives are handled pretty well and keep employees in mind.

review_title: I worked for HF for 10 years.  The first 8 years were great, the last 2 were horrible.
pros: My coworkers were like family.  I developed lifelong friendships with a lot of them.  Patient safety is always priority.
cons: Administration is out of touch with what it's like to work on the floor as a RN.  Short staffed all the time.  Patient to nurse ratio unsafe.

review_title: For health care professionals, this is probably the best place to work in Brevard County
pros: Organization is committed to providing excellent and safe patient care, and creating a positive work environment for employees during an extremely challenging period of increasing health care costs.  Wages are moderately competitive compared to other hospitals in central FL.
cons: Overall value of my benefit package diminished significantly over the years. During 2 of the 10 years of my employment, merit and cost of living increases were not awarded to employees. Per diem staff do not receive benefits or annual pay increases but were often expected to work full time hours. Hospital tends to push "Diversity" too far and employs a large number of HB1/foreign nationals from abroad to save on payroll costs (instead of providing those jobs to US citizens).

pros: I liked the people I worked with at the staff and peer level.  The benefits were good; pay was average to slightly above average
cons: Constant leadership reorganization, going back at least a decade and continuing.  Growing faster than infrastructure and talent can support.  Unable to feel proud about the health care delivery system.   Quality employees are overworked, not to keep up or make progress, but just to keep from failing.

review_title: Great Company, But Smaller, With Less Opportunity To Move Up
job_title: Patient Benefit Advisor in Melbourne, FL
pros: This company has great health insurance benefits, seeks feedback from associates, and has given me a great work/life balance that I had not been able to enjoy prior to working here.
cons: It is very difficult trying to move up in this company. I already had a bachelor's degree, but had to come into the company through dietary back in 2012 and transferred to my current department a year later. I have been trying to transfer into other departments in order to utilize my degree for the last year without luck.

job_title: Revenue Cycle Analyst in Rockledge, FL
pros: Awesome company with great benefits
cons: So far the only thing I can say is that the micromanaging of your employees leaves a lot to be desired.  Employees are great and they don't need a manager to stand over them and critique their work.  They do an awesome job-let them do it without the recording of the calls.  Honestly is this a job or a jail?

job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Melbourne, FL
pros: Fellow employees are pretty good. Departments generally tend to work well with one another. Ability to move to different departments once you're in the system.
cons: Seems to have a hard time keeping staff due to morale, chronic under-staffing, and personality conflicts, among other reasons. Health insurance only covers within the its own area and Florida Hospital system - don't get sick outside of Brevard/Orlando area!

job_title: Revenue Cycle Specialist in Melbourne, FL
pros: The supervisors & managers are very helpful. The policies they have in place to ensure everything goes smoothly is awesome.
cons: Currently the personal leave policy is horrible. The first day you are sick, it is taken out of your personal leave time instead of sick leave time. Also, I do not think I am getting a fair pay but it is still better than what I was making which is zero.

pros: good medical benefits, hires within and room for growth
cons: if a manager feels they don't like you for some reason, they will find a way to fire you-and there is no "chain of command" as long as its within your first 90 days. Basically you walk on eggs shells for the first 90, having no rights. They make it clear about that. Making sure they remind you "we can get rid of anyone for any reason within their first 90 days".

review_title: Health First is a great place to work!
pros: Health First is a great place to work! They strive to provide Quality Care. The people truly care about each other and the patients and their families that count on them for care. Health First consistently gives back to the Community ❤️
cons: If your heart is not into making a connection to your patients - this will not be a good fit for you.

job_title: Patient Care Specialist in Melbourne, FL
pros: Great people, great benefits.  There was never a dull moment.  Every day I felt of value and always learned new things.  It was challenging as well as fulfilling.  Great managers, coworkers, and physicians.  Truly a caring and positive environment.
cons: When it comes to disability (specifically mental health,  bipolar - manic episode...they have zero tolerance and you will be terminated.  If you have mental illness, which is not understood by many, you are easily expendable...even after being a dedicated, hardworking employee with nothing but positive reviews for the past five years.

pros: This is difficult. I am asked o say something positive about the company... Their insincere rhetoric is commendable.
cons: The leadership continues to try and line their pockets and do not give the least little concern for the community or the employees. They have reduced employee benefits and earnings by continually reducing 401k contributions, vacation pay, sick leave, night differential, and bonuses for the workers(but not for any of the Board of Directors or Higher Management). Yet each fiscal year they make a large profit(yet it is a non-profit company).

review_title: Used to be a nice place to work
pros: My co-workers really took the team approach seriously
cons: Leadership is so out of touch w those that actually touch patients. They are clueless! One of their brilliant ideas was to decrease the number of CNAs on the unit and increase the number of patients per nurse yet they couldn't figure out why scores went down? Really?

job_title: Advanced (Charge) Registered Respiratory Therapist in Indialantic, FL
pros: Night shift therapists are a tight crew encouraging independent thinking.  Current supervisor great advocate for his therapists.  Charge therapists voices are LARGELY heard.
cons: ICU docs make it difficult to care for ventilated patients because they have different expectations.  Day and night crew don't necessarily cover each others' backs.  However, if one proves themselves a sound clinician with good integrity, they will do great.

review_title: Horrible management, Unbelievable how bad things are and how much employees hate working for health first.
job_title: Full Time CT/Xr Tech in Palm Bay, FL
pros: Benefits, some friendly coworkers, nothing else to be happy about, leaving was the biggest pro since day one. I wouldn't advise anyone to even apply until things change and they lie nonstop so ask current employees if anything changed, Viera is even worse they say
cons: Worst management ever, horrible Drs who don't know how to order exams or what to order. Working 8 and 12 hour shifts on the weekends with no breaks, way understaffed with no care about patient care.  Patient waiting over a hour for a portable chest X-ray is complete bs

job_title: Radiologic Technologist, RT(R) in Melbourne, FL
pros: Affordable health insurance with good coverage, free gym membership. Work environment and coworkers really depend on location, but there are many locations and departments and it's pretty easy to transfer between.
cons: Benefits have slowly been decreasing in quality over the years due to budget cuts. No longer able to accrue unlimited amounts of PL, also no longer able to cash out PL. My top complaint: holidays come out of PL bank, so employees have to accrue their holiday pay, which is awful for those who are hired FT right before the holidays (me..).

pros: Smart people to work with; great flexible working environment; extremely wonderful benefits; educational opportunities including tuition reimbursement and classes offered; growth and development opportunities;
cons: There were some issues with the rumor mill; company is small so not well fine tuned yet but overall very smart people to work with and a great place to be.

review_title: Don't bother this place does not value its employees
pros: Decent benefits, lots of areas to work in
cons: Too much turn over of management, not enough training, poor communication from managment, peers complain mgmt via email about peers, cut-throat environment, peers verbally abusive, staff to nurse ratio dangerous, charge nurses sit around doing nothing and don't offer support answer questions, mgmt keeps adding on responbilites- do I need to say more

review_title: Strong organization, but over emphasis on bottom line, and drifting away from employee focus.
pros: Currently good financial position, and has a  modern infrastructure. The area has positive quality of life amenities that make it good place to live and work
cons: High stress culture driven by short term focus on bottom line at the expense of long term employee development and engagement.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Melbourne, FL
pros: I've worked in many different facilities; This company by far has the BEST hiring process ever... They are very attentative to thier employees during the onboarding process and throughout; Not to mention a company that owns thier own health insurance as well, which is a bonus. Lot's of oppertunity for growth, not only company wise, but profession as well.
cons: I've only been here for roughly a month, so I will update as I go along but the only con for me thus far is that it is the distance.... to be continued...

pros: HF is a fast growing company with great opportunities for advancement in the right department, great benefits and pay.
cons: Many supervisors and managers need to be educated in Business Etiquette and learn to maintain a positive work environment for all and to all employees.

pros: Most open and transparent company I've ever worked for.  We are growing and making a difference in the community.  Allows associates to be passionate, even with that involves some "heat".  I feel more engaged here than I have with any past employer.
cons: The only "con" that I can think of is that the weather stinks in the summer.  And sometimes the lagoon does, too.  Maybe Health First can do something about that.

job_title: Lab Support Technician in Melbourne, FL
pros: Vacation time, paid sick time, ability to work full, part, or per diem. Benefits are amazing.
cons: We make less than the secretaries even though we have to be certified and work a high-risk job with needles, blood, and other bodily fluids. Also very clicky with coworkers and due to high turn over rate people that should have been let go years ago get kept around just so we have bodies to fill positions.

review_title: Management will use you and spit you out in a heartbeat
pros: The health insurance is good, most coworker are awesome.
cons: Management is horrible, very fast to judge but when it's time to get to work and you need help, management disappears.   Not enough staff, dangerous place to work for staff and for patients.

review_title: I have never felt such disrespect, shame and hurt in my entire 25 years of working.
pros: I was excited about work every day. The RN's I worked with was so supportive and kind. Staff is important.
cons: Micromanagement is very stressful. An employer must know and trust that his/hers employees will do their job. Competently.

job_title: Volunteer Patient Care Representative in Melbourne, FL
pros: The older folks working there and volunteers were sweet, close-knit. Heart Center is a great facility and the patients I was around were usually very satisfied with care.
cons: Main hospital building was not in good shape, constant construction, some very rude physicians that got into some huge debacles with patients. It's a mess sometimes, communication isn't the best, and some seriously out of date equipment.

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Palm Bay, FL
pros: Decent work/life balance, decent pay compared to most places in Brevard.
cons: Seems they would rather keep unskilled and untrained people in management roles and lose good hourly employees because they are easier to replace.  Computer systems are outdated and inefficient.

pros: Great people who work together. And care about the patients
cons: Always short, can't go to lunch due to legal issues of having to ha so many nurses on floor with pts. Management doesn't care how many patients are scheduled even if it is 8 to 1. MMA doesn't help most of the time. You get written up for BS. Nurses are allowed not to do certain procedures for religious reasons and others haven't to pick up the slack, and if you say anything you get written up.  Pay is at the scale of 1990's.  Don't see your manager unless your in trouble.

pros: Fellow employee's excellent, lot of hours
cons: They will use you up, Holmes is fine Palm Bay Hosp. stay away expect to do everything at night ,fix tv's, beds, transport,switch out beds, set up all ortho appliances for nurse's, preform ekg's. No extra pay especially when you are teaching employees w/ more experience and a hire pay grade. Will make up falsehoods to get rid of you if you buck the system  STAY AWAY always short handed

review_title: Just another brevard county joke of an employer
pros: Benefits, competitive pay, I ran out of things to put as pros
cons: Supervisor only saw me for maybe 5 minutes a week from the time I was hired, everyone just plays the blame game.  Training is an organized joke. Pushy about religion(ex bible verses in company wide emails)

review_title: Just another brevard county joke of an employer
pros: Benefits, competitive pay, I ran out of things to put as pros
cons: Supervisor only saw me for maybe 5 minutes a week from the time I was hired, everyone just plays the blame game.  Training is an organized joke. Pushy about religion(ex bible verses in company wide emails)

review_title: Not What it used to be
pros: Expanding to and attempting to change with the ACA.  Decent 301k and vacation benefits
cons: Unrealistic expectations of workers by overloading them with work and fragmented tools to do work.  Management is either ignorant or apathetic to issues in the workplace.  This will continue with current projected plan

review_title: Assisted patient with insurance co-pay and deductible. Provided referral for Medicaid, Medicare, disability, and other c
job_title: Insurance Benefit Advisor in Palm Bay, FL
pros: Great benefits, awesome staff always working together to help the patients, professional, integrity
cons: Many patient did not have insurance or money to pay their bills. There were the hardship application to assist, however difficulty trying to find outside resources to help them

job_title: Personal Trainer in Cape Canaveral, FL
pros: Busy place,  lots of hours if you want it but low pay for those hours
cons: They change the terms of employment frequently, and do not apply their rules equally across the board.  If they are short handed, they will overlook their own policies to get new hires or hours covered after making other current employees jump through hoops and pay for licenses or certifications that they don't make new hires get.  Unfair, unequal treatment.    In addition, no cost of living increase in ten years,  and some employees say it's been twenty years since they got a raise

job_title: Lead Equipment Tech in Melbourne, FL
pros: Friendly staff. Good work schedule. Located in central part of city. Close to schools, shopping, churches, eating establishments.
cons: Upper management micromanages. Not a lot of upper management interaction with the average working associate. Not always able to get supplies to do the job properly.

review_title: It's like a bomb, about to implode; not explode.
pros:
-It's great if you are working on the right floor; meaning the staff aren't burned out.
-Otherwise, you might be lucky enough to find a great team of nurses that have your back.
-Work nights if you want some sanity left.
-You might get a free meal on some special occasions (if you're lucky)
cons:
-Staffed burned out = poor patient care
-Dayshift = Hell
-High management & RN turnover, incompetent, some amateur, new managers hired (I'm sure previously fired for incompetence)
-poor patient safety due to lack of staff secondary to high staff turnover (could be people leaving/transferring or being unfairly judged)
-they preach "customer satisfaction" while piling on the workload with lack of staff, but management offers next to no support while pointing fingers for poor unit results.
-Mostly graduate nurses hired due to RNs quitting/transferring, so patient safety declines
-Voicing your opinion (regardless of context) in their "I-CARE" environment paints a target on your back and your job
-They want robots; robots don't talk or defend themselves from unfair/unfounded scrutiny
-Forget about trying to get your timecard corrected and the money you worked for promptly, if at all.
-Kiss your PL bye-bye unless you plan on being sick for an extended period of time to collect on their sick-leave pay.
-Don't expect to see your SL when you leave; they'll take that from you too.

pros: Meeting many new people.  Seeing how important each employee was regardless of their specific job,  Nurses and housekeeping alike.
cons: Management lacks communication. No one ever knew what was going on. Some staff was allowed to slack with no repercussions while others were continually called out for the smallest things.

pros:
The people- easy to create a work family out of a team.

Benefits package
cons:
Corporate objectives often superseded fair treatment of associates

Subterfuge often used at upper levels to manipulate middle level leaders and hide true intentions of division leaders. 

Traditional power play roles often used in division meetings.

job_title: Team Leader in New York, NY
pros: Great job for those willing to work hard to succeed which is better than other companies where no matter how hard you work there are no chances of getting anywhere.
cons: Not for the timid or faint of heart. It can get quite depressing which makes a huge impact on results. And this company wants results.

review_title: Stressful environment with very low wages
job_title: Lab Support Technician in Melbourne, FL
pros: Affordable medical benefit package for individuals and family members. Dental and vision packages are eparate but affordable.
cons: Very low wages  for an individual  who is a vital asset to the medical field. High risk job for very low wages.

pros: Many different people within the company
cons: Company doesn't care anything about healthcare of patients.  Only cares about MONEY.  There were MANY rounds of layoffs while I worked there and benefits are only becoming worse and worse.  Most people within the organization are dissatisfied with the company and the direction it is going in but they are afraid to speak up.  The company will even fight you on unemployment filings when the law is in YOUR favor.  STICK UP FOR YOURSELF!

review_title: Why I worked here for 26 yrs
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Bay, FL
pros:
Busy Level II trauma center. Working in Transfusion Medicina allowed me to play an important role in patient care.
Pay is better than other hospitals in the area.
Very involved in the community
cons: Did not agree with the change in PL accrual.

job_title: Department Office Assistant Scheduler in Melbourne, FL
pros: Competitive pay, good health benefits, many facets of the company, large presence within the area, good security force and safety regulations
cons: Corporate plays favorites, HR unhelpful, depending on location not much room for growth but many lateral movements available, hiring outside candidates more than inside candidates

pros: Medical benefits, large network, free gym.
cons: High turnover, no consistency with management, each department has different expectations, no brand loyalty to employees. Low pay. Does not respect loyalty, or seniority.

pros:
Great benefits
Competitive Wages
Market Adjustments
Great people
Always looking to improve
cons:
Needs more staff - there always seems to be a shortage somewhere
Required to work 6 weekend shifts per 6 week schedule with no weekend differential

pros: They have given me the opportunity to learn a new skill to pass on knowlege of new software for electronic medical records,
cons: New management that is not very caring of personal growth with time to learn changes in policy and protocols.

pros: Great salary and benefits, great professional and knowledgeable colleagues.
cons: Sr. Leaders not all on the same page.  Mixed messages to associates and middle management.  Trying to accomplish too much too fast so many important initiatives are not implemented fully or successfully.

pros: They have been outstanding thru the Covid crisis! Really working to be better then they are, trying new ways to improve customer and employee experience.
cons: They have a point system that is some what unreasonable.

pros:
People that work on the unit 
Pay is compatible with other area hospitals
cons:
Admin does not care 
Ppl are overworked , go without lunches many days . 
Keep asking for more

job_title: Revenue Cycle Specialist II in Rockledge, FL
pros: Wonderful manager, awesome staff that is always willing to help others on the team
cons: Not employed long enough to have any negative feedback

review_title: Drastically Downhill is the last 2 years
pros: Dynamic environment, caring associates, even though senior leadership has an inhumane lack of compassion, the associates themselves are compassionate and believe in the mission.
